intro: Ruellia sceptrum-marianum, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are square and hairy. Ruellia sceptrum-marianum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
